intro: Erigeron canadensis var. glabratus, commonly known as Canadian fleabane, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm, featuring a basal rosette of gray-green, hairless leaves. The plant produces daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow central disk, blooming from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in a variety of habitats, including fields, roadsides, and disturbed soils. This variant is distinguished by its smooth, glabrous leaves, setting it apart from other varieties of Erigeron canadensis.
